intro: Therorhodion camtschaticum var. barbatum, commonly known as the Caucasian rose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically reaches a height of 1 to 2 meters and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant blooms and fragrant scent.
